intro: Bonafousia hirtula, commonly known as the hairy bonafousia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bonafousia hirtula is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to thrive in semi-desert conditions.
